text: You can throw error on the rate limit error and the WF will rerun

Hi everyone, does anyone know how to retrieve the associated user id to each goal from the goals api in HubSpot? The documentation only mentions the hs_created_by_user_id which is not what we need.  Would be great to hear if anyone knows about a work around. Thank you.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/goals>

Hi <@U05CJMDM467>,

Thank you for your response.

We're limited to utilizing only one Private App, which is globally employed across the website to generate contacts in HubSpot through v3 API calls. Is there an alternative method available within the constraints of one Private App in v3 to store contact source indicators (e.g., Paid social, Paid search) in the 'Original source drill-down 2' filter option? Your attention to this matter is greatly appreciated, and we eagerly await your response.

Hello,
With the API endpoint when you create a previously defined event definition that was deleted, we get this error: `OBJECT_ALREADY_EXISTS` even if the definition is not listed (either when looking at the web UI OR using the event definition query API).

I realised that the web UI append a `_v2`, `_v3` and so on to the event definition names.

So how can it ever by possible to use the API to completely delete an event definition or verify if the name has already been taken in the past? This behaviour makes impossible to use the API in the context of stand alone applications!

Hello friends!

I am working on creating/deleting/updating HubSpot webhook subscriptions via API. I have had success with getting and creating subscription, however I am having troubles deleting subscriptions.

The documentation on this entire section misses out the need to include hapikey as a URL parameter, particularly in the endpoints tab it does not accurately document how to properly delete a webhook subscription.


Any help would be appreciated, thanks!
Are you using code to update the property or it is set by HubSpot

Hello folks
This problem still persisting.
Note the following screens, the API is showing the reverse of the original from the portal.
Hey everyone. How would I go about sending an API to retrieve tasks that are only due 3 days from the present date or due on the present date?

<@U05CJMDM467> I tried that and it didn't seem to work - do you know what I was doing wrong here?
```try {
            await axios({
              method: 'delete',
              url: `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/leads/${lead.id}>`,
              headers: axiosHeaders
            });
            console.log(`Deleted lead ${lead.id} because it was not the most advanced in the pipeline or the most recently updated.`);
          } catch (error) {
            if (error.response && error.response.status === 429) {
              console.error('Rate limit hit during deletion, throwing an error to trigger a retry.');
              throw new Error('Rate limit hit during deletion');
            } else {
              console.error(`Failed to delete lead with ID: ${lead.id}. Error: ${error.response ? error.response.data : error.message}`);
            }
          }```

`throw error`

Not 

‘throw new Error(..)’

It’s how HS says it would do the retry
Thing to note about this workflow is.,, moment record is deleted, the workflow stops cos no record again, it will look like an error but it makes sense

Hi peeps!
Just wanted to verify if it's possible or not to fetch all contacts from a certain contact list using the v3 API?
My bets were either (1) /crm/v3/objects/contacts/search with a field search by `listMembership`
or finding a v3 version of the list API that would return all Contact objects associated with that list?
Omg I knew it was probably something dumb I did. Thank you!
So all good? It’s not your fault. Just takes some exposure
